description: L2/L3 완전 커버리지 달성 - 최종 12스테이지 (L2 잔여 6 + L3 잔여 6)

stages.title: 빈도·시간 결합 — every/each + 시간표현
stages.intent: every day/week/month, each time 등으로 정기적인 습관과 반복을 자연스럽게 표현한다.
lexset: every day/week/month/year, each time/morning, once/twice, daily, weekly, monthly, regularly
traps: every vs each 구분(every student vs each student)
시간 전치사(every Monday vs on Mondays)

seeds.en: I exercise every day.
We have a meeting every Monday.

seeds.kr: 한 달에 한 번 영화 봐.
seeds.en: I watch a movie once a month.
I'm late each time.
I swim twice a week.
I travel every year.
I get checkups regularly.
I drink coffee each morning.
How many times a week do you exercise?
I read several books every month.

stages.title: 미래표현 혼합 — will/be going to/현재진행형 미래
stages.intent: will(즉석 결정), be going to(계획), 현재진행형(확정 일정)의 차이를 이해하고 상황에 맞게 선택한다.
lexset: decide, plan, arrange, schedule, promise, predict, intend, expect, probably, definitely
traps: will vs be going to 선택(즉석 vs 계획)
be going to 축약(I'm gonna go ✗ in formal)

seeds.en: It will rain tomorrow.
I'm going to go shopping this weekend.
I'm meeting a friend tomorrow.
I'll help you.
I'm going to buy a new car.
I'm watching a movie at seven.
I'll probably be late.
I'm going to get married next year.
What are you going to do?
I'm leaving soon.

stages.title: 전치사구 심화 — 장소·방향·시간 복합
stages.intent: 전치사구를 복합적으로 사용하여 정확한 위치, 방향, 시간을 세밀하게 표현한다.
lexset: in front of, behind, next to, between, among, across from, through, around, towards, away from
traps: 복합 전치사 순서(in front of vs front of ✗)
between vs among(두 개 vs 여러 개)

seeds.en: Let's meet in front of the bank.
It's between the two buildings.
I walked through the park.
I parked behind the school.
I live across from the station.
I was among the people.
I walked towards home.
There's a bookstore next to the cafe.
Where shall we meet?
It's near the city center.

stages.title: 의문사 + to부정사 — What/How/Where to do
stages.intent: 의문사 + to부정사로 방법, 선택, 계획을 간결하게 묻고 답한다.
lexset: know, learn, decide, choose, find out, figure out, remember, forget, understand, explain
traps: 의문사 + to 구조(What to do vs What I should do)
동사 선택(know how to vs know to how ✗)
to 생략 금지(how do vs how to do)

seeds.en: I don't know what to do.
Tell me how to do it.
Have you decided where to go?
Let me know when to meet.
I don't know who to ask.
I'm thinking about which one to choose.
I want to learn how to cook.
I need to decide where to live.
I don't know what to wear.
I'll tell you how to get there.

stages.title: 조건문 2형 기초 — If I were/had
stages.intent: If I were you, If I had money 등으로 가상의 상황과 조언을 자연스럽게 표현한다.
lexset: were, had, could, would, might, rich, young, free, different, possible, advice, choice
traps: was vs were in conditional(If I was vs If I were)
주절 조동사(I would go, not I will go)

seeds.kr: 내가 너라면 그렇게 안 할 거야.
seeds.en: If I were you, I wouldn't do that.
If I had money, I would travel.
If I had time, I could help you.
If I were young, I would study again.
It would be nice if he came.
What would you do if you were rich?

seeds.kr: 다시 선택할 수 있다면 달리 할 거야.
seeds.en: If I could choose again, I would do differently.
If she were here, she would help.
If I had a car, I would pick you up.
If I were free, I would travel the world.

stages.title: Tag Questions — isn't it? / don't you? / 확인 질문
stages.intent: 부가의문문으로 확인, 동의, 놀라움을 자연스럽게 표현하고 적절히 응답한다.
lexset: nice, good, difficult, expensive, late, early, busy, tired, happy, cold, hot, right, wrong
traps: 긍정-부정 매칭(It is, isn't it? / It isn't, is it?)
대답 방식(Yes, it is / No, it isn't)

seeds.en: It's nice weather, isn't it?
It was difficult, wasn't it?
You're not busy, are you?
You can do it, can't you?
He didn't come, did he?
It's expensive, isn't it?
We're late, aren't we?
It was fun, wasn't it?
It's cold, isn't it?
That's right, isn't it?

stages.title: 현재완료 vs 과거 정확한 구분
stages.intent: 현재완료와 과거시제의 차이를 명확히 이해하고 상황에 맞게 정확히 선택한다.
lexset: yesterday, last week, ago, recently, lately, just, already, yet, ever, never, since, for
traps: 완료 vs 과거(I have seen vs I saw)

seeds.en: I saw a movie yesterday.
Have you seen that movie?
I have just arrived.
When did you arrive?
I have been busy recently.
I was busy last week.
I have already finished.
I finished an hour ago.
Have you ever been to London?
I went to London last year.

stages.title: 수동태 + 시제 — 과거완료/미래/현재완료 수동
stages.intent: 다양한 시제의 수동태를 정확히 구성하고 자연스럽게 사용한다.
lexset: build, complete, repair, publish, discover, invent, solve, announce, cancel, postpone
traps: 시제별 수동태 구조(will be done, has been done)

seeds.en: The house has been sold.
The bridge will be completed next year.
The building had already been demolished.
The book has been translated into several languages.
The meeting will be cancelled.
The problem has been solved.
A new medicine has been discovered.
The airport will be closed.
The report had already been submitted.
The plan will be announced.

stages.title: 조건문 혼합 패턴 — 0/1/2형 실제 사용
stages.intent: 조건문 0형, 1형, 2형을 실제 상황에서 적절히 선택하여 자연스럽게 사용한다.
lexset: fact, possibility, advice, regret, warning, prediction, suggestion, consequence

seeds.en: If you boil water, it evaporates.
If it rains, I'll stay home.

seeds.kr: 돈이 있다면 새 차를 살 텐데.
seeds.en: If I had money, I would buy a new car.

seeds.kr: 일찍 오면 좋은 자리 구할 수 있어.
seeds.en: If you come early, you can get a good seat.
If I were you, I would apologize.

seeds.kr: 늦지 않으면 영화 볼 수 있어.
seeds.en: Unless you're late, you can watch the movie.
If you study hard, you succeed.
If I had time, I would go with you.
If it doesn't rain, we'll go on a picnic.
If I were healthy, I could go hiking.

stages.title: 대조·양보 — although/however/on the other hand
stages.intent: although, however, on the other hand로 대조와 양보를 논리적으로 표현한다.
lexset: although, though, however, nevertheless, on the other hand, in contrast, despite, whereas
traps: although vs but 동시 사용 금지

seeds.en: Although it was raining, I went out.
It's difficult. However, it's interesting.
He's busy. On the other hand, I'm free.
Though I was tired, I kept working.
It's expensive. Nevertheless, it's good.
Although I studied, I failed the exam.
The weather wasn't good. However, we enjoyed it.
Though I don't have money, I'm happy.
He's young. On the other hand, he's experienced.
Although I was late, I attended.

stages.title: 간접의문문 고급 — 복잡한 구조
stages.intent: 복잡한 간접의문문을 정확한 어순으로 구성하고 자연스럽게 사용한다.
lexset: wonder, ask, tell, know, remember, forget, understand, explain, find out, figure out

seeds.en: I wonder when he will come.
I asked where we should meet.
Tell me why you were late.
I forgot how to do it.
I don't know if he will come.

seeds.kr: 뭘 하고 있었는지 기억 안 나.
seeds.en: I don't remember what I was doing.
Do you know who called?
Think about how long it will take.

seeds.kr: 어느 것이 더 나은지 결정할 수 없어.
seeds.en: I can't decide which one is better.
I'm not sure if that's correct.

stages.title: 관계대명사 기초 — who/which/that
stages.intent: 관계대명사 who, which, that으로 문장을 자연스럽게 연결하고 정보를 추가한다.
lexset: person, people, man, woman, book, movie, place, thing, idea, problem, solution, way
traps: who vs which vs that 선택
전치사 위치(the person I talked to)

seeds.en: He's the person who I met yesterday.
It's the book that I read.
The movie which we saw was interesting.
She's the teacher who teaches English.
It's the computer that I bought.
It's the place where we live.
It's the food that I like.
He's the friend who helped me.
It's the problem that we discussed.
It's the way that I was looking for.
